absyn

Class ClassMemberDeclaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • absyn.Absyn
      • absyn.ClassMemberDeclaration
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CodeDeclaration, FieldDeclaration

    public abstract class ClassMemberDeclaration
extends Absyn
    A node of abstract syntax representing the declaration of a class member i.e., a field, constructor or method of a Kitten class.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getSignature

        public abstract ClassMemberSignature getSignature()
        Yields the signature of this class member declaration.
        Returns:
        the signature

      • toDot

        public final java.lang.String toDot(java.io.FileWriter where)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Writes in the specified file a dot representation of this node of abstract syntax. It writes a single dot node for this node of abstract syntax and it calls the auxiliary toDotAux(FileWriter) method. Subclasses should redefine the latter in order to consider components of abstract syntax classes. If there is a subsequent class member declaration, it calls itself recursively and builds a bold arc from this declaration to the dot representation of the subsequent one.
        Parameters:
        where - the file where the dot representation must be written
        Returns:
        the name used to refer to this node in the dot file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem while writing into the file

      • typeCheck

        public final void typeCheck(ClassType currentClass)
        Type-checks this definition of a class member. It calls the auxiliary typeCheckAux(ClassType) method and then continues recursively with the subsequent members.
        Parameters:
        currentClass - the semantical type of the class where this member occurs. This will be bound to the implicit this parameter
